news_header: Archaeologists have discovered a significant part of London's first basilica, a 2,000-year-old Roman public building, beneath an office block scheduled for demolition.
news_original_title: Beginnings of Roman London discovered in office basement
news_text: This find includes sections of stone walls and artifacts, shedding light on the origins of London and its historical importance. The basilica was part of a larger forum used for political and economic activities. The discovery will influence the redevelopment plans of the site, incorporating the archaeological remains into new offices for public access.
